dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Four currencies, right? You can hold KZT, USD, EUR, and RUB all in one Tayyab account.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Four currencies, right? You can hold K Z T, U S D, E U R, and R U B all in one Tayyab account.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can store money in four currencies Kazakhstan KZT, USD, EUR, RUB, and you can withdraw cash at any ATM in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just a multi-currency card—it's fully Shariah-compliant, verified by the Shariyah Review Bureau in Saudi Arabia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just a multi-currency card-it's fully Shariah-compliant, verified by the Shariyah Review Bureau in Saudi Arabia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Compliance with the principles of Islamic finance is confirmed by the international Shariah Board Shariyah Review Bureau (Saudi Arabia), as well as the Spiritual Administration of the Muslims of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a big deal for users who want their finances aligned with Islamic principles. No interest charged or earned on balances.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a big deal for users who want their finances aligned with Islamic principles. No interest charged or earned on balances.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Customer card balances are not used to generate interest income, and interest is not charged on them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And you can get the card instantly through their app, Tayyab, which is available on both Apple Store and Play Market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And you can get the card instantly through their app, Tayyab, which is available on both Apple Store and Play Market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can issue the card in a minute by installing the mobile application Tayyab in Apple store or Play market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I like that they've integrated lifestyle features too—like finding halal cafes or prayer rooms nearby.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I like that they've integrated lifestyle features too-like finding halal cafes or prayer rooms nearby.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to the convenience of using financial functions in line with the latest world trends, we provide our users with a convenient service for practicing the Islamic way of life, for example, only in the tayyab application you can easily find the nearest mosque, prayer room or halal cafe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. The app even has prayer times, a Qibla compass, zakat calculator… it's really holistic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. The app even has prayer times, a Qibla compass, zakat calculator... it's really holistic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The application also has prayer times and Azan, Qibla compass, Zikr counter, Zakat calculator and much more notes Daniyar Uspanov, Tayyab CEO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just digital—you can order a physical VISA card with hand delivery if you want.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just digital-you can order a physical V I S A card with hand delivery if you want.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If necessary, you can order a plastic VISA card with hand delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But with clear restrictions, right? Like, you can't use it at casinos or places that sell alcohol or tobacco.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But with clear restrictions, right? Like, you can't use it at casinos or places that sell alcohol or tobacco.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additional features of Tayyab first digital Islamic card are that it is not intended for payment in casinos, as well as in any gambling and lottery establishments, specialized stores selling alcohol and tobacco products, while the restriction does not apply to department stores selling groceries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, though it does work at regular grocery stores even if they sell those items—so that's practical.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, though it does work at regular grocery stores even if they sell those items-so that's practical.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additional features of Tayyab first digital Islamic card are that it is not intended for payment in casinos, as well as in any gambling and lottery establishments, specialized stores selling alcohol and tobacco products, while the restriction does not apply to department stores selling groceries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And instant worldwide payments through Apple Pay and Samsung Pay… that's huge for travelers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And instant worldwide payments through Apple Pay and Samsung Pay... that's huge for travelers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instant transfers and contactless payments can be made immediately worldwide using Apple pay and Samsung pay wallets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It was launched just in time for Eid al-Adha this year, which is pretty symbolic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It was launched just in time for Eid al-Adha this year, which is pretty symbolic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The launch of the project was timed to coincide with the main Islamic holiday Eid al-Adha, which falls on July 20 this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Backed by some serious names too—Bank RBK, VISA, even Dubai Fintech Ventures as an investor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Backed by some serious names too-Bank R B K, V I S A, even Dubai Fintech Ventures as an investor.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The card was launched by the first Kazakhstan Islamic fintech Tayyab in partnership with Bank RBK and the VISA payment system. One of Tayyab's institutional investors is Dubai Fintech Ventures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely feels like a step forward for Islamic fintech, especially coming from Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely feels like a step forward for Islamic fintech, especially coming from Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The card was launched by the first Kazakhstan Islamic fintech Tayyab in partnership with Bank RBK and the VISA payment system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: If you're curious, the website is tayyab.com—worth checking out if ethical banking matters to you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: If you're curious, the website is the website -worth checking out if ethical banking matters to you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can download the Tayyab application and issue a card on the Apple store for iPhone and Play market for Android smartphones, and for more information, visit www.tayyab.kz

artist_script:
HostA: Four currencies, right? You can hold KZT, USD, EUR, and RUB all in one Tayyab account.
HostB: Yeah, and it’s not just a multi-currency card—it’s fully Shariah-compliant, verified by the Shariyah Review Bureau in Saudi Arabia.
HostA: That’s a big deal for users who want their finances aligned with Islamic principles. No interest charged or earned on balances.
HostB: Exactly. And you can get the card instantly through their app, Tayyab, which is available on both Apple Store and Play Market.
HostA: I like that they’ve integrated lifestyle features too—like finding halal cafes or prayer rooms nearby.
HostB: Oh, for sure. The app even has prayer times, a Qibla compass, zakat calculator… it’s really holistic.
HostA: And it’s not just digital—you can order a physical VISA card with hand delivery if you want.
HostB: But with clear restrictions, right? Like, you can’t use it at casinos or places that sell alcohol or tobacco.
HostA: Yeah, though it does work at regular grocery stores even if they sell those items—so that’s practical.
HostB: And instant worldwide payments through Apple Pay and Samsung Pay… that’s huge for travelers.
HostA: It was launched just in time for Eid al-Adha this year, which is pretty symbolic.
HostB: Backed by some serious names too—Bank RBK, VISA, even Dubai Fintech Ventures as an investor.
HostA: Definitely feels like a step forward for Islamic fintech, especially coming from Kazakhstan.
HostB: If you’re curious, the website is tayyab.com—worth checking out if ethical banking matters to you.
